section.title: Upgrade Tempest as Service
section.para: In &kw-hos-phrase;, Tempest has been modelled as a service and this gives you the ability to locate Tempest anywhere in the cloud. It is recommended that you install Tempest on your &clm; node as that is where it resides by default in a new installation.

When you are upgrading from &kw-hos-phrase; 3.0, you must add tempest as a service in you cloud definition after the upgrade completes. Typically, you will add an entry in the file ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml:
section.screen: control-planes: - clusters: - allocation-policy: strict member-count: 1 name: cluster0 server-role: DEPLOYER-ROLE service-components: - lifecycle-manager - ntp-server - tempest
section.para: Commit your changes and re-run the configuration processor:
section.screen: cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible git add -A git commit -m "Add explicit tempest service deployment" ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
section.para: Now, run the following commands to deploy tempest as a service:
section.screen: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/ardana/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-refresh-facts.yml guard-deployment.yml tempest-upgrade.yml hlm-cloud-configure.yml
